thread.title: Furyk to miss Presidents Cup, replaced by Holmes
thread.title_full: Furyk to miss Presidents Cup, replaced by Holmes

title: Furyk to miss Presidents Cup, replaced by Holmes
text:
Updated: 2:54 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 | Posted: 2:54 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 Furyk to miss Presidents Cup, replaced by Holmes By DOUG FERGUSON The Associated Press PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla. — 
Jim Furyk decided Friday to remove himself from the U.S. team at the Presidents Cup because of a wrist injury. 
He was replaced by J.B. Holmes, who was 12th in the standings. 
Furyk withdrew from the BMW Championship because of a deep bone bruise in his left wrist, and he sat out the Tour Championship last week with hopes it would get better. 
After rest and treatment, the 45-year-old Furyk did not think he was fit enough to play. 
U.S. captain Jay Haas picked Holmes to replace him. The Presidents Cup starts Thursday in South Korea. Copyright The Associated Press
